dt: {bc}a privilege, gain, or profit incidental to regular salary or wages
{bc}something held or claimed as an exclusive right or possession

et: Middle English, property acquired by means other than inheritance, from Anglo-French {it}perquisit{/it}, Medieval Latin {it}perquisitum{/it}, from neuter of {it}perquisitus{/it}, past participle of {it}perquirere{/it} to purchase, acquire, from Latin, to search for thoroughly, from {it}per-{/it} thoroughly + {it}quaerere{/it} to seek
shortdef: a privilege, gain, or profit incidental to regular salary or wages; especially : one expected or promised
something held or claimed as an exclusive right or possession
